title: Honoring Dr. Michael G. O'Leary upon the occasion of his designation for special recognition by the Columbia County Community Services Board
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE RESOLUTION honoring Dr. Michael G. O'Leary upon the occasion
of his designation for special recognition by the Columbia County Commu-
nity Services Board

WHEREAS,  It is the sense of this Legislative Body to recognize that the
quality and character of life in the communities across New  York  State
are  reflective of the concerned and dedicated efforts of those individ-
uals who would devote themselves to the welfare of the community and its
citizenry; and
  WHEREAS, Attendant to such concern, and in full accord with its  long-
standing  traditions, this Legislative Body is justly proud to honor Dr.
Michael G. O'Leary upon the occasion  of  his  designation  for  special
recognition by the Columbia County Community Services Board, to be cele-
brated  on  Wednesday,  January  26, 2011, at Kozel's Restaurant in West
Ghent, New York; and
  WHEREAS,  Dr.  Michael  O'Leary,  retired  as  Director  of  Community
Services  for  Columbia  County on June 30, 2010; he had been affiliated
with the Columbia County Department of Human Services since 1981,  first
as  Clinical  Director  of  the  Mental  Health Center and since 1997 as
Director of Community Services; and
  WHEREAS, As Director, Dr. Michael O'Leary appreciated the complexities
of individuals in his care and accepted the obligation of providing  the
best services within the mental hygiene framework; he worked as an advo-
cate and supported family and consumer involvement through NAMI, provid-
er advisory groups and self help organizations; and
  WHEREAS,  Local initiatives under Dr. O'Leary's leadership included an
integrated treatment  model  for  individuals  with  mental  health  and
addiction  issues,  services  to the jail to engage inmates in treatment
through jail based outreach, screenings and assessments to reduce  reci-
divism;  a  Suicide  Prevention Task Force to examine local suicides and
implement prevention strategies and active participation in the  Suicide
Awareness  Walks  sponsored  by  the  American  Federation  for  Suicide
Prevention; and
  WHEREAS, Each year Dr. O'Leary, with  the  Columbia  County  Community
Services  Board,  would sponsor Legislative Forums which highlighted the
complex needs of individuals served through mental hygiene providers and
annual dinners in order to recognize local community members who  demon-
strated  a  commitment  to  improving  the  lives  of individuals served
through mental hygiene providers; and
  WHEREAS, A resident of Nassau, New York, Dr.  Michael  O'Leary  earned
his  Master's  degree  in  Social  Work from Syracuse University and his
Doctorate  from  Adelphi  University;  he  has  conducted  research  and
published  articles  on topics related to pretherapy training as well as
the impact of managed care on services to the mentally ill; in addition,
he has taught graduate level human behavior theory  courses  and  social
work  practice  courses  for 30 years at the State University at Albany;
and
  WHEREAS, The New York State Chapter of the National Alliance on Mental
Illness has recognized Dr. O'Leary  for  his  leadership  in  the  fight
against  stigma  within  the community; he also serves as an officer and
committee chair with the New  York  State  Conference  of  Local  Mental
Hygiene Directors; and
  WHEREAS,  Dr.  O'Leary  recently  received  an Outstanding Achievement
Award for leadership in joint planning from the State  Commissioners  of
Mental  Health, Alcohol and Substance Abuse Services and Mental Retarda-
tion and Developmental Disabilities; and

  WHEREAS. With him throughout have been his three children, all of whom
feel privileged to be a part of his life and  rejoice  in  his  achieve-
ments; and
  WHEREAS,  Dr. Michael O'Leary's distinguished record merits the recog-
nition and respectful tribute of this Legislative Body;  he  is  a  true
asset to society; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
honor Dr. Michael G. O'Leary upon the occasion of  his  designation  for
special recognition by the Columbia County Community Services Board; and
be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Dr. Michael G. O'Leary.
